texts.definition: Gameplay consisting of putting tokens into a bag and later removing them from said bag.
markups: <style="Definition">Gameplay consisting of putting tokens into a bag and later removing them from said bag.</style>

Many games use randomness to create uncertainty in games. One way of doing this is through putting different types of tokens into a bag and later drawing them. Games with <style="CurrentLink">Bag Building</style> make it into a gameplay aspect of choosing which tokens to place in a bag and when to draw tokens from that bag.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hyperborea">Hyperborea</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Yggdrasil">Yggdrasil</link></style> are examples of <style="CurrentLink">Bag Building</style> games, the former one where every player has their own bag and the latter one where four bags are jointly manipulated by all players. Others are <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Orleans">Orleans</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Altiplano">Altiplano</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Bag Building</style> can be seen as an alternative to <style="Link"><link="deck-building">Deck Building</link></style>. The main design options regarding <style="CurrentLink">Bag Building</style> is what type of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style> can be placed in a bag, when players get put <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style> in a bag, and when players draw <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style> from the bag. Another important design choice is whether bags are individually owned by players or if they are <style="Link"><link="shared-resources">Shared Resources</link></style>.

Games with <style="CurrentLink">Bag Building</style> can allow players the possibility of manipulating the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style> within bags through <style="Link"><link="bag-management">Bag Management</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Bag Building</style> is a way to make use of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style> as <style="Link"><link="investments">Investments</link></style>. It creates <style="Link"><link="randomness">Randomness</link></style> since the idea of using bags is to make it uncertain which <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style> are drawn when some <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style> should be drawn.
